The term “No Man’s Land” usually refers to a territory which is under no one’s control, be it a person or a nation. This diplomatic theory was brought into effect in the early 20th century where war torn countries decided to have a buffer zone between disputed border lines. It resolved disputes regarding historical claims over land. In the modern world, claims have somehow trespassed the borders and entered into the lives of daily city dwellers; but it has taken a different form altogether. It has shaped into what many might term as the “ancestral upper hand”. Modern living instruments have put people into shared spaces through apartments and planned neighborhoods. When you purchase apartments and move into a new shared community, you would always want to stand your ground and move in as an equal. However, at most instances the stakes are in favor of former land owners, who have given out their land to the development company or real estate firm. When most realtors offer a significant share of the developed building instead of buying out the propertyoutright, the balance of ownership at your purchased apartment building is tilted towards the former landowners. In this case you might be left with uneven placement and share of the land, less of a say in common building community rules, and face more of what we just termed as “ancestral upper hand” from your very neighbors who cannot help it because that is also true.

Usual problems that might fall in your plate could come in the form of restriction to use the rooftop, difficulties in washing the car inside the parking area, or even use of tap water for car wash. Sometimes the ground staff may seem to not obey anyone else but the true landowner. It could be termed as a complex authoritative attitude that they pose leads to certain elements like their unwillingness to evenly pay for common utility bills and put extra fees on the shoulders of other residents.

EDISON REAL ESTATE for instance, develops real estate in fully purchased own land. This provides Edison
with a clear advantage over other developers who share rights to the land with prior owners. The projects
are fully planned and designed to equally fit all apartment owners into an accommodating residential space. The development process moves forward without the tiring decision making and interference of land co-owners, and thus the process takes the shortest of time. In this scenario you would be handed over your apartment in the shortest time with full freedom to enjoy all the amenities dedicated to the residents.

In the capital, strengthened by future projects in surroundings, the neighborhoods in Bashundhara R/A are very serene and peaceful. Each and every road is carefully named and organized into Blocks. The land sizes are much bigger here creating room for availing much more amenities one desire to enjoy amidst this humdrum of the capital. And as build on acquired lands by the developer the projects are an attractive choice of investment class assets leapfrogging others mode of projects as joint ventures and land sharing ones.

So don’t delay, book your dream home from array of exclusive projects built upon 400 Katha of own land
by EDISON REAL ESTATE, which become lands of magical adventure, discovery, growing up, friendships, laughter and family time. Where swimming pools, fitness centers, lounges, meet and greet areas, child play zones, roof top gardens are open to the entire community of the biophilic spaces. A human centric
experience dedicated to more than values these abodes have to offer about life. It is through your true
provision of equity in your residence you can claim it as either “your land” or “no man’s land”!
